result.execSummary:
The defendant Orlin Lee Webster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid through the Clerk of Court's Office
To be paid through the Clerk of Court's Office

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
Maintain absolute sobriety. Agent can approve the defendant's appearance in Class B establishments due to work, if necessary.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
Take all medication as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed.

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed. No objection to transferring jail time in another county. Report on 12/26/17 at 8:30 AM unless arrangement were made to serve the sentence in another county (Shawano County. Follow jail rules in regards to report times if reporting in Shawano County.
To be performed by completing 20 hours every three months once released from jail.

superMiscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain part time employment/school that consists of at least 20-24 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 4 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

records.descr: Corrected Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:48 AM. Judge Habeck appears via video from Shawano County and goes thru collaquey with the defendant to make sure he is OK with Judge Habeck appearing via video as the defendant has a right to the Judge appearing in person. Webster is OK with Judge Habeck appearing via video. Court has received several letters from family members of Mr. Webster and those individuals are in the courtroom today. All parties have received the revocation paperwork with no errors or inaccuracies. Court would like to know the criminal history of the defendant. State gives that, makes argument prior to his recommendation, recommends 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2.5 years of initial confinement followd by 3.5 years of extended supervision - credit for 171 days (stipulated). Burns makes final argument prior to her recommendation - first of all disputes the argument that the defendant is not eligible for either of the programs and will be asking for him to be allowed eligibility - recommends 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision - credit for 171 days - asks the Court to make him eligible for all programs. Court asks the State if he knew why DOC would be requesting no programs for the defendant. Webster makes statement, remorseful but wants to give the Court his side of the "story". Court sentences the defendant to the following: 4 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2.5 years of initial confinement followed by 1.5 years of ES - credit for 171 days, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgments, felony rights given, right to appeal, conditions of ES to include: absolute sobriety, maintain/obtain part time employment/school (20-24 hrs/week average - 4 places per week for job search if not employed/school), P&P can assign any other conditions that it deems appropriate, eligible for both programs - to be completed by 6/7/19, adjourned.
Character references from 3 different individuals
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 7, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney David Vernon Penn.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:25 PM. Penn provides Court with plea questionnaire and state's settlement recommendation. Court reviews - looks like the defendant will plead G to count #1 as alleged. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - count #2 would be DRI. Webster understands that and is willing to proceed to sentencing today. Court dismisses and reads in count #2. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - recommends a withheld sentence, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 365 days in FC jail, reimburse Forest County Drug Task Force the amount of $150.00, costs, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or Class B establishments, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, take medications that are prescribed to him by a treating physician or medical are provider and only in the manner in which they are prescribed, take any over-the-counter drugs only in the manner in which they are labeled. Penn makes final argument prior to sentencing - asks that the defendant be able to serve any sentence in any other county in the State of WI - asking for time to report to get that lined up - recommends a withhled sentence, place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, recommends 4 months in FC jail with huber and huber transfer and allow 2 weeks for a report time. State does inform Court that the defendant has a current warrant out of Brown County. Penn comes up with 6 days credit. Webster makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: $150.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted - remainder due in 60 days/CO, reimburse FOSO the amount of $150.00 for drug buy reimbursement - take bond posted, submit DNA sample, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, agent can approve the defendant's appearance in a Class B establishment due to work if necessary, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service to be performed at least 20 hours every three months when released from jail, take all meds as prescribed and in the manner in which they are prescribed, 365 days in FC jail - huber allowed - credit for 6 days only if revoked - no objection to transferring jail time in another county - report on 12/26/17 at 8:30 AM unless arrangements were made to serve the sentence in another county (Shawano County) - follow jail rules in regards to report times if reporting in Shawano County, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney David Vernon Penn.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 1:20 PM. Penn there is a plea agreement and informs court of employment injury and may need more surgery, asks for a PLEAS date in about 90 days. State does not object to adjourn. Court will allow adjournment of PLEAS.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 15, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 4, 2017 at 03:45 pm.
Defendant's Supplemental
Final pre-trial on April 5, 2017 at 11:45 am.
Final pre-trial on January 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any class B establishments.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:59 PM. Court reviews file, defendant had informed the Court at the last hearing that he was going to hire private counsel. Webster - did not have enough money for a private attorney, since has contacted SPD, has Attorney Thoms here from Menominee Tribal Court. Court finds that Attorney Thoms is not a licensed attorney in the State of WI. Webster - stated he contacted SPD. State asks to verify this information with SPD. Court calls SPD in Court. SPD states that he still qualifies for SPD, states that she was just made aware today of the defendant's need for a SPD appointment. Webster said that he called SPD about 10 days ago and left them a message and never received a call back until today. Court asks for the defendant's criminal history. State - frustrated that the defendant waited til recently to contact SPD, asks Court to consider a $1000 cash bond. Court is also concerned about the delay in contacting SPD. Court - bond - adds additional $500.00 signature bond today with same conditions. Court sets for FPT on 1/10/17 at 2:00 PM.  Final pre-trial scheduled for January 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Supplemental Discovery - Defendant
Final pre-trial on November 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
No consumption of alcohol and no entry into any class B establishments

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:36 PM. State has been handed a supplemental demand for discovery by Voorhees and Voorhees files it with the Court as well. Voorhees - requests leave of the Court to withdraw as counsel for stated reasons (potential conflict), has discussed this with the defendant and he will try to obtain counsel and if unable to - he (defendant) will contact SPD to get subsequent counsel assigned. Webster agrees, is trying to hire counsel on his own. Court will allow the withdrawal of counsel, will continue bond, set for another FPT on 11/8/16 at 2:45 PM. State asks the Court to remind the defendant what his conditions of bond are as he is no longer represented by counsel at this time. State willing to change bond to no consumption of alcohol and no entry into any class B establishment, deleting the no-contact condition. Defendant instructed to bring his new attorney with him to the next hearing.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:22 AM. records.addlTxt: timely
SA

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:29 PM. Also called 16CF14. State calls Deputy Jason Novak. Voorhees asks for sequestration of witnesses. Court grants sequestration. Novak sworn in at 1:20 PM. Direct exam by State. Voorhees objects - overruled (1:21 PM). Cross exam by Voorhees at 1:26 PM. State objects - relevance - overruled (1:28 PM). State asks if file has a proof of service for witness Sanapaaw, asks for an adjournment. Voorhees leaves the decision up to the Court. Court will allow an adjourment of the PH after no objections stated by Voorhees. Court continues bond on this matter and sets for an adjourned PH. Court moves on to PH for 16CF14.  State calls Detective Thomas Robinson. Robinson sworn in at 1:34 PM. Direct exam by State. Voorhees objects - hearsay - overruled but noted on the record. Discussion on hearsay again, overruled, record made by Voorhees. State continues with direct exam (1:41 PM). Record reflects proper identification of the defendant (1:48 PM). Cross exam by Voorhees at 1:49 PM. State objects - sustained (1:49 PM). State objects - overruled (1:52 PM). State objects - sustained (1:53 PM). State objects to line of questioning - discovery in nature - sustained (1:53 PM). State objects - sustained (1:55 PM). Court finds probable cause on this matter that a felony may have been committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Voorhees has Information and wants a recess to discuss it with the defendant. Recess at 1:56 PM. Back on record at 2:06 PM with same appearances. Voorhees renews request for a continuance of ARGN for stated reasons. Recess to file request for substitution. Recalled at 2:10 PM. Voorhees files written request for substitution. Court continues bond and will accept RFS as timely.

Defendant Orlin Lee Webster appears via video from FC jail, in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 16CF13 & 16CF14. Here for INIT appearances. Defendant has received a copies of both complaints. Court reads charges & penalties. Webster understands charges on both complaints. Voorhees waives further reading. State asks for a $1000 cash total for both cases, no contact with minor victim (UCS). Voorhees asks for signature bond. Court imposes $2500 signature bond in 16CF13 with conditions of no contact with minor victim(UCS) and no consumption of alcohol and $500 cash bond in 16CF14 with conditions of no contact with minor victim (UCS) and no consumption of alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
